You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show the Locale Switcher Widget

Support buyers who purchase for multiple languages and geographic regions. When you enable the Locale Switcher widget, a buyer can easily swap between supported locales from the header on your storefront. Selecting a new locale shows localized storefront content and currencies, if available.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
Pages	All pages
Page layouts	Any page layout
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To create CC Page Label records:	Create on CC Page Labels
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
NOTE The Locale Switcher widget isn't available for a customer service representative (CSR) while they're logged in to the storefront on behalf of a buyer.

A Locale label appears in the header on all storefront pages.

When a buyer clicks the locale in the header, the buyer can select a different locale from the list of locales you enabled for the storefront.

By default, the picklist shows each locale's code, such as en_US or ja_JP. Optionally, you can create a page label that displays some other value, such as English or English (en_US). For help with creating these page labels, see step 1.

NOTE
When an authenticated user changes locale, the Language field of their user record updates for the selected locale. B2B Commerce for Visualforce loads only the language for the selected locale, and doesn't change currency.
When a guest user changes locale, B2B Commerce for Visualforce updates the locale in the value of the cclcl URL parameter. B2B Commerce loads both the language and currency for the selected locale.
In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13), the B2B Commerce Header component for Experience Builder site page supports the Locale Switcher widget. When a buyer navigates to an Experience Builder site page instead of a Visualforce storefront page, the cclcl parameter switches to the site's language URL. The selected language persists even when a buyer navigates between Experience Builder and Visualforce pages.

To enable the Locale Switcher widget for your storefront:

Optionally, create a page label to replace a default locale code in the Locale Switcher picklist with a custom value.
On the CC Page Labels tab in your org, click New.
For Page Name, enter All.
For Page Label Name, enter the prefix LOC_ followed by the exact, case-sensitive locale code you want to replace. For example, to replace the default en_US locale code in the Locale Switcher picklist, enter LOC_en_US.
Specify a Storefront.
For ValueRT, enter the text that you want to appear in the Locale Switcher picklist. For example, to show English instead of en_US, enter English.
TIP To include the default locale code in your custom value, add the {0} variable. For example, to show English (en_US), enter English ({0}).
Save your changes.
Repeat these steps for other locales.
TIP
If you localize your storefront, also create a localized page label record.
If you've enabled page label caching, refresh the cache after you modify page label records to show your updates on the storefront.
Update your storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Locale Switcher (3).
Find the Enabled configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Locale Switcher
Configuration	Enabled
Page	all
Value	TRUE
IMPORTANT To show the Locale Switcher widget in an Experience Builder site, update the metadata for this configuration so that the Externally Safe option is TRUE. Complete the steps in Upgrade to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (Version 4.13).
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO

title: Enabling Locale Switcher Widget for B2B Commerce
